actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on December 12, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Schweikert moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 11, 2024, at 1:00 p.m.: That the Senate agreed to S. Con. Res. 43 and S. Res. 925, and passed S. 4776, H.R. 1097, H.R. 3254, H.R. 3797, H.R. 3801, H.R. 6829, H.R. 6960, and H.R. 7872.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the National Emergency with respect to global illicit drug trafficking declared in Executive Order 14059 of December 15, 2021, is to continue in effect beyond December 15, 2024.
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-184).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to serious human rights abuses and corruption declared in Executive Order 13818 of December 20, 2017, is to continue in effect beyond December 20, 2024.
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-183).
Mr. Rogers (AL) asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on December 12. Agreed to without objection.

Mr. Rogers (AL) asked unanimous consent that the proceedings during the former Members program be printed in the Congressional Record and that all Members and former Members who spoke during the proceedings have the privilege of revising and extending their remarks. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Con. Res. 134 — "Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make a correction in the enrollment of the bill H.R. 5009."
Mr. Rogers (AL) asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House agree with an amendment to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 281

actions-list.actionItem: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 499).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 9716 — "To amend the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to require the Congressional Budget Office to provide baseline updates, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the votes on motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 9716 and on motion to concur in the Senate amendment with an amendment to H.R. 5009.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 5009, the Chair put the question on concurring in the Senate amendment with an amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Rogers (AL) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to concur in the Senate amendment with an amendment to H.R. 5009.
Mr. Rogers (AL) moved that the House concur in the Senate amendment to the bill, H.R. 5009, with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 118-52.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1612, Mr. Rogers (AL) called up the Senate amendment to H.R. 5009.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9716.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Moore (UT) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9716 — "To amend the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to require the Congressional Budget Office to provide baseline updates, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8753.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Boebert moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8753 — "To direct the United States Postal Service to designate single, unique ZIP Codes for certain communities, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Barry Moore to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
